events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving their vehicle and another driver.
Claim was categorised under the 'Auto Accident' cluster after reviewing the initial report mentioning vehicle damage and collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case and contact the customer to gather further details about the auto accident.
Customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim was received and is under review by the insurance company.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report pertaining to the accident for further processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents including vehicle photos, accident report, and initial repair estimates.
The claims investigation team began a detailed review of the submitted documents and contacted the repair shop for assessment.
Investigation concluded that the accident was mostly the other driver's fault with partial liability on the customer.
A settlement offer was made to the customer covering the estimated repair costs minus deductible as per policy terms.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely communication.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer for the vehicle repair.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account covering the approved settlement amount for the accident damages.
The claim was closed successfully after all payments were processed and repairs were confirmed complete.
